S

SECONDS_PER_DAY - Static variable in class socialSecurityDeathIndex.TimeSpan
The number of seconds in a day
setAddRecords(Boolean) - Method in class socialSecurityDeathIndex.SSDIprogram
Sets or clears the "add records on read" option
setBirthDate(TimeSpan) - Method in class socialSecurityDeathIndex.DeathRecord
Set the range of dates / times within which the decedent's moment of birth is known to reside
Used when constructing a death record from a source other than a DeathMasterFile
setCurrentRecord(IDeathRecord) - Method in class socialSecurityDeathIndex.MainForm
Set the current record under examination in the program
The Social Security Account Number (SSAN) of the current record is displayed in a text box in the user interface.
setDatabasePort(int) - Method in class socialSecurityDeathIndex.SSDIprogram
Sets the port number the database server is expected to be listening on
setDatabaseType(String) - Method in class socialSecurityDeathIndex.SSDIprogram
Sets the String identifier of the database to be connected.
setDeathDate(TimeSpan) - Method in class socialSecurityDeathIndex.DeathRecord
Set the range of dates / times within which the decedent's moment of death is known to reside
Used when constructing a death record from a source other than a DeathMasterFile
setGivenName(String) - Method in class socialSecurityDeathIndex.DeathRecord
Set the given (first) name of the decedent
Used when constructing a death record from a source other than a DeathMasterFile
setMasterFile(String) - Method in class socialSecurityDeathIndex.MainForm
Set the path of the Social Security Death Index master file to be loaded.
The value of this property is displayed in a text box in the user interface.
setMiddleName(String) - Method in class socialSecurityDeathIndex.DeathRecord
Set the middle name (or initial) of the decedent
Used when constructing a death record from a source other than a DeathMasterFile
setSSAN(long) - Method in class socialSecurityDeathIndex.DeathRecord
Set the Social Security Account Number of the record
Used when constructing a death record from a source other than a DeathMasterFile
setSurname(String) - Method in class socialSecurityDeathIndex.DeathRecord
Set the surname (last or family name) of the decedent
Used when constructing a death record from a source other than a DeathMasterFile
socialSecurityDeathIndex - package socialSecurityDeathIndex
Provides the classes necessary to load United States Social Security Death Index master files into a database, and execute queries against that database.
SPONSOR - Static variable in class socialSecurityDeathIndex.BeanDatabaseConnection
Unique String identifier for this database implementation
SPONSOR - Static variable in class socialSecurityDeathIndex.MySqlDatabaseConnection
The sponsor (vendor) name for this database type
SPONSOR - Static variable in class socialSecurityDeathIndex.SqlServerDatabaseConnection
The sponsor (vendor) name for this database type
SqlServerDatabaseConnection - Class in socialSecurityDeathIndex
Makes a connection to an SQL Server database, using Microsoft's com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver driver.
SqlServerDatabaseConnection() - Constructor for class socialSecurityDeathIndex.SqlServerDatabaseConnection
Creates a new instance of an SqlServerDatabaseConnection object
SSAN_COLUMN - Static variable in class socialSecurityDeathIndex.DatabaseConnection
Social Security Account Number column name in the database table
SSAN_ENDING_COLUMN - Static variable in class socialSecurityDeathIndex.DeathRecord
Social Security Account Number (last column)
SSAN_STARTING_COLUMN - Static variable in class socialSecurityDeathIndex.DeathRecord
Social Security Account Number (first column)
SSDIprogram - Class in socialSecurityDeathIndex
Simple client program for loading the master files and executing queries
STATE_CODE_ENDING_COLUMN - Static variable in class socialSecurityDeathIndex.DeathRecord
State/Country code of residence (last column)
STATE_CODE_STARTING_COLUMN - Static variable in class socialSecurityDeathIndex.DeathRecord
State/Country code of residence (first column)
